required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectivenes of Erector Spinae Plane Block in Percutaneous Nephrolithotomy?
clinical_study.official_title: SHOULD THE ERECTOR SPİNAE PLANE BLOCK BE APPLIED IN THE PAIN MANAGEMENT OF PERCUTANOUS NEPHROLITOTOMY SURGERY?

brief_summary.textblock: This study investigates the effectiveness of the erector spinae plane block (ESPB) in pain management of patients undergoing PNL.

detailed_description.textblock:
Although percutaneous nephrolithotomy(PNL) is a minimally invasive procedure, it causes severe postoperative pain due to dilatation of the renal capsule and parenchymal duct and peritubal distension of the nephrostomy tube. PNL-related pain has a limited response to oral and intravenous treatments. The primary aim of our study is to investigate the effectiveness of the erector spinae plane block (ESPB) in pain management of patients undergoing PNL.
Our secondary aim is determining if any possible clinical effect of ESPB in terms of serial peak expiratory flow measurements, postoperative agitation score of the patient (Riker Score), ambulation time, length of hospital stay.

primary_outcome.description: the amount of pain that a patient feels ranges across a continuum from none(0) to an extreme amount of pain(10) on a chart.
the amount of pain during mobilization, deep breathing or coughing that a patient feels ranges across a continuum from none(0) to an extreme amount of pain(10) on a chart
maximum speed of expiration as measured with a peak flow meter

secondary_outcome.description: Time between end of surgery and patients first analgesic demand
first postoperative mobilization time of the patient
postoperative agitation score unarousable very sedated sedated calm and cooperative agitated very agitated dangerous agitation

secondary_outcome.measure: patient satisfaction with anesthesia and analgesia
secondary_outcome.description: 4 Likert scale ( the level of satisfaction of a patient ranges from satisfied (1) to nonsatisfied(4)

secondary_outcome.measure: urinary catheter releated pain score(Visual Analog Scale)
secondary_outcome.description: the amount of pain that a patient feels ranges across a continuum from none(0) to an extreme amount of pain(10) on a chart.

secondary_outcome.measure: surgeon satisfaction with anesthesia and analgesia
secondary_outcome.description: 4 Likert scale ( the level of satisfaction of surgeon ranges from satisfied (1) to nonsatisfied(4)

arm_group.description: Conventional intravenous analgesia applied according to surgeon's preference

A 6-13 MHz linear probe was used for ultrasound‐guided ESPB (Logiq e, General Electric, USA,) performed at the T11 level. The transverse process was detected by sliding the transducer 3‐4 cm laterally from the midline, and after identification of the transverse process, a 20‐gauge 100mm insulated echogenic needle (Vygon locoplex, France) was used

intervention.description: we administer 15 cc of 0.5% bupivacaine between the erector spine muscle and the transverse process. The distribution of bupivacain was observed on ultrasound.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients undergoing PNL between 18-65 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- serious cardiac, respiratory, hepatic, renal or haemotologic disease
- mental disorder and hearing problem
- anxiety, depression and / or other psychiatric disorders
- pregnancy
- refusal of patient
- Allergy or contraindications to drugs used in the study
- ASA > 2 Inflammation or infection over injection site Obese patients BMI ≥35/

reference.citation: Ibrahim M, Elnabtity AM. Analgesic efficacy of erector spinae plane block in percutaneous nephrolithotomy : A randomized controlled trial. Anaesthesist. 2019 Nov;68(11):755-761. doi: 10.1007/s00101-019-00673-w. Epub 2019 Oct 16.
